activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P Bomkamp

records.addlTxt:
3:07 PM Defendant Michael P Bomkamp not in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Michael P Bomkamp.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Meyer-O'Day states that his client thought his hearing was tomorrow and not today. Attorney Meyer O'Day asks for a reset. State doesn't object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
September 28th Preliminary Hearing removed to be reset as a Status Conference.
request to remove prelim from calendar and set for status at a later date and time
notice of witness list, and petition for leave to file additional motions

Adjustment Number: 22A 005767,
Payable Number: 67015,
Receipt Number: 22R 004081,
Amount: $20.00

No acts or threats of violence with anyone including the victim.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

1:11 PM Defendant Michael P Bomkamp in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Meyer O'Day appears in person. Attorney Meyer O'Day waives the formal reading. Max penalties. Attorney Meyer O'Day speaks about bond modification. Max penalties stated. Attorney Meyer O'Day waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing.

Attorney Meyer O'Day address bond and asks for no violent or abuse contact with the victim. Attorney Forehand doesn't object to the bond modification.

Court will remove:
Defendant can't reside at the residence of the victim during the hours of 10 PM to 6 AM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Address stated on bond: 30920 Dog Hollow Road, Cazenovia WI 53924

4:44 PM Defendant Michael Bomkamp in court, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. Attorney Erickson appears for this case only and doesn't qualify for the public defenders office.

Attorney Harper request $1,000 cash bond.
Victim speaks and would like the no contact waived.
State asks for a no acts or threats of violence and no drink.
Defendant can't reside at the residence of the victim.

Attorney Erickson heard and request a signature bond.

Court orders:
$1,000 cash bond

No acts or threats of violence with anyone including the victim.

Defendant can't reside at the residence of the victim during the hours of 10 PM to 6 AM.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Initial set for 08/11/22 at 1 PM
